<title>Competition Rules - Titanic: Machine Learning from Disaster | Kaggle</title>
<meta name="description" content="Kaggle is your home for data science. Learn new skills
column4: and compete in world class machine learning challenges." />

column1: • Michael Stokley
You must accept this competition's rules before you'll be able to download files.
You cannot sign up to Kaggle from multiple accounts and therefore you cannot submit from multiple accounts.
Privately sharing code or data outside of teams is not permitted.
It's okay to share code if made available to all participants on the forums.
Team mergers are allowed and can be performed by the team leader. In order to merge
column2: the combined team must have a total submission count less than or equal to the maximum allowed as of the merge date. The maximum allowed is the number of submissions per day multiplied by the number of days the competition has been running.

column1: You may submit a maximum of 10 entries per day.
You may select up to 5 final submissions for judging.
This is a fun competition aimed at helping you get started with machine learning.  While the Titanic dataset is publically available on the internet
column2: looking up the answers defeats the entire purpose.  So seriously
